articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Belgian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong NamGreets Belgian King
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Albert II, king of Belgium, on its national day.
					 Kim in the message wished the Belgian people prosperity.

articles.title: Mongolian PM Hopes for Expanded Cooperation with DPRK
articles.content:
Mongolian PM Hopes for Expanded Cooperation with DPRK 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Prime Minister Sukhbaataryn Batbold met and had a friendly talk with the DPRK delegation headed by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun at the State Building on July 18.
					 The prime minister hoped that cooperation would further expand between the governments of the two countries.
					
					 The relations between Mongolia and the DPRK have long history and tradition, he said, adding: This year marks the 55th anniversary since President Kim Il Sung visited Mongolia and laid a basis for the bilateral relations of friendship.
					
					 We are rejoiced over the great successes made by the Korean people to greet 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, he said.

articles.title: Trademark Law Amended in DPRK
articles.content:
Trademark Law Amended in DPRK
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK amended the Trademark Law in the first and fifth chapters.
					 The first chapter has amendments in the 2nd, 5th and 6th articles stipulating trademark, its variety, principles of defending trademark copyright, modernizing the trademark business and putting it on a scientific basis. 
					
					 In the fifth chapter, the 41st, 42nd, 43rd, 44th and 47th articles were revised. They are related to affairs of guiding bodies, opening of relevant affairs to the public, consolidation of material and technical foundations of the trademark business, training of officials concerned, prohibition of illegal action concerning trademark, compensation for loss, confiscation and suspension of business.
					
					 The amendments are aimed to provide a legal guarantee for improving trademarks and properly defending copyright along with the economic growth and increased production of goods.

articles.title: Gift from Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Vietnamese Delegation 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting delegation of the Press and Information Department of the Vietnamese Foreign Ministry headed by Director General Nguyen Phuong Nga.
					 The head of the delegation handed the gift over to an official concerned on Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
articles.content:
DPRK Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Academic degrees and titles were conferred on intellectuals who achieved successes in the drive to implement the Workers' Party of Korea's line of attaching importance to science and technology with due ceremony Wednesday.
					 The title of candidate academician went to Ri Sung Ik, chief of an institute of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, Jong Jong Su, researcher at Pyongyang Agricultural College of Kim Il Sung University, Choe Hwa Il, teacher of Pyongyang University of Railways, and Kim Pong Il, chief of an institute of Nampho University of Agriculture.
					
					 Professorship was awarded to Kim Yong Il, a teacher at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, Jo Chang Jun, department head of University of National Economics, Ri Won Mo, researcher of Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies, and Mun Chang Ryong, dean of a faculty of Phyongsong University of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry.
					
					 Doctorate was conferred on Jon Tong Chol, dean of a faculty of Kim Il Sung University, Choe Yong Chol, a teacher of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Kwon Myong Gon, deputy chief engineer of the Rakwon Machine Complex, and others and associate professorship on 73.

articles.title: Coal Mines Damaged by Heavy Rain
articles.content:
Coal Mines Damaged by Heavy Rain 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Coal mines in the DPRK suffered damage from heavy rainfalls that hit the country from July 12 to 15.
					 Tens of pits and some 150 cutting faces of over 30 coal mines in the western part of the country were submerged. And hundreds of thousands of tons of coal were washed away from some 40 coal yards. 
					
					 Bridges were destroyed and railways wrecked by landslides in Sunchon, Tokchon and Pukchang, causing obstacle to coal transport in the areas.  
					
					 Production has been suspended in coal mines belonging to the Hamnam and Chonnae area coal mining complexes with many pits and cutting faces inundated and pumping equipment not working properly for electricity shortage.
					
					 The recent downpours seriously affected the coal output and transport and electricity production of the country.

articles.title: New Drama Makes Hit
articles.content:
New Drama Makes Hit 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- A new drama "We Will Recollect Today", a laureate of Kim Il Sung Prize, has been performed to a full house at the National Theater in Pyongyang. 
					 The drama is based on strenuous efforts made by people in a mountainous county to build a minor power station in the 1990s when the country was in hard time. It mirrors their love for their native land.
					
					 Undaunted by repeated natural disasters and difficulties caused by the imperialists' economic sanctions, they push ahead with the construction of the power station with the help of servicepersons.
					
					 They finally make a breakthrough in the construction project of great significance in improving the living standard.  
					
					 The drama represents the noble spiritual world of those devotedly working for the prosperity of the nation.
					
					 It also shows what made the Korean people redouble their effort for the prosperity of the country in the difficult period.
					
					 The lesson given by the drama is that those who devoted themselves to the future of the country will be pleased to recollect their worthwhile effort but those who failed to do so will regret their past mistake.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (17)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (17)
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Ordinary art squad members have grown to be heroes thanks to the paternal loving care and trust of the peerlessly great man.
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il learned about the distinguished agitation activities for increased production conducted by the couple, Ri Ok Sil and Kim In Bok of the Jagang Provincial Art Squad who participated in the national meeting of activists in the field of agitation for increased production in March 1999. He showed such deep trust and benevolence for them as making sure that they were awarded the title of hero at the same time. He said that such persons loved and recognized by the people are genuine heroes.
					
					 The couple worked heart and soul to repay his trust and loving care by singing all their lives.
					
					 They conducted agitation activities for increased production hundreds of thousands of times at the grand socialist construction sites, including the construction site of the Huichon Power Station, for decades after leaving their happy family. However, they found the worth of living in doing so. This story is touching people.
					
					 Drum beating made by the couple for the good of the country and people is ringing out more loudly at the Hungnam gasification construction site and industrial establishments and cooperative farms across the country.

articles.title: US Submarine Texas' Entry into Pusan Port of S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
US Submarine Texas' Entry into Pusan Port of S. Korea under Fire 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- It is a grave military provocation that the U.S. recently brought its nuclear submarine Texas belonging to the U.S. 7th Fleet carrying latest hardware including Tomahawk missiles to Pusan Port of south Korea, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined commentary. 
					 This reveals the criminal scenario of the U.S. warmongers to ignite a new war on the Korean Peninsula at any cost, the paper says, adding: 
					
					 Lurking behind its entry into the south Korean port is the strategic scenario of the U.S. imperialists to browbeat the DPRK by force of arms and flexibly cope with the "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 What merits particular attention is that the submarine made this portcall, timed to coincide with the provocative anti-DPRK remarks made by Walter Sharp, the then commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea, shortly ago. Sharp blustered it was necessary to promptly cope with additional provocation by north Korea and the U.S. and south Korea maintain strong alliance. 
					
					 It is the invariable policy of the U.S. imperialists to retain its grip on south Korea, its only colonial military base in Asia, and use it as a forefront base for carrying out its strategy of aggression on the DPRK and the rest of Asia and a stronghold of military and strategic importance. 
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. conceal or justify the sinister intention of the U.S. imperialists to perpetuate their military presence in south Korea and ignite another Korean war at any cost. 
					
					 The U.S. will have nothing to gain from its moves to escalate confrontation and start a war against the DPRK. The U.S. would be well advised to clearly understand the revolutionary will and mental power of the army and people of the DPRK, give up its scenario to ignite a new war and pull its troops out of south Korea as early as possible.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Rason Economic and Trade Zone in DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Rason Economic and Trade Zone in DPRK
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The Rason Economic and Trade Zone in the DPRK has favorable conditions for becoming a worldwide trade and investment center linking Northeast Asia with Europe and North America. It is linked with China and Russia with River Tuman in between and facing the East Sea of Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Northeast Asia includes Korea, Heilongjiang, Jilin and Liaoning provinces of China, the Fareast region of Russia, Mongolia, Japan and others. The region has a population of several hundreds of millions and covers 9,168,000 square kilometers. Countries in the region have favorable conditions for economic cooperation and exchange. 
					
					 The northeast area of China has fertile farmland and mountainous areas including high mountain range linked with Mt. Paektu of Korea. It produces tens of millions of tons of grain annually. It is the world's leading producer of bean. This region abounds in timber of great economic value and has hundreds of species of medical plants. It is rich in underground resources and has more than a hundred kinds of metal ores. 
					
					 The Fareast region of Russia close to Rason City borders on northeast part of Mongolia and faces China with Amur River (Heilongjiang) and Ussuri River in between. As most of its territory is covered with mountains, the region is rich in forest resources and oil, natural gas, tin, lead and zinc and other underground resources.
					
					 The Rason Economic and Trade Zone is situated in such favorable geographical position that it can link with three provinces in northeast of China, the Fareast region of Russia, Mongolia and other areas which have appeared promising economic and trade regions in Northeast Asia. Ports in the Fareast region of Russia are said to remain frozen in winter. That is why the Rason area can be a favorable transport hub. 
					
					 The area will be a friendly economic and trade zone conducive to economic development, traffic and transport and welfare of the peoples of the two countries of DPRK and China. It will also promote the economic development in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world. 
					
					 The advantages of the area as an economic and trade zone are evidenced by the fact that the DPRK and Russia held a ceremony of rebuilding Rajin-Khasan Railways and Rajin Port in 2008. 
					
					 The use of this new route would help cut down transport distance from Asia to Europe to dramatically reduce transport expenses.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Implement North-South Declarations
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Implement North-South Declarations 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, serve as banner for achieving independent reunification to be invariably held aloft at all times as they are the most just reunification programme common to the nation, a full embodiment of the three charters for national reunification. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					 The above-said declarations reflect the idea of national independence and the ways for achieving great national unity and independent and peaceful reunification of the country clarified and indicated by the three charters for national reunification, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration calls for solving the issue of the country's reunification independently by the concerted efforts of Koreans who are responsible for it while the October 4 declaration reaffirms the main spirit of the joint declaration.
					
					 The idea of "By our nation itself" specified in the north-south joint declarations represents the will to reunify the country and open a new history of national prosperity by rallying all Koreans who love the country and nation through reconciliation and unity between the north and the south.
					
					 The joint declarations indicate specific ways for boosting cooperation and exchange between the north and the south in all domains including politics, economy and social culture to preserve national character which has been steadily handed down through generations and achieve uniform development of national economy.
					
					 They also indicate practical ways for putting an end to military stand-off on the Korean Peninsula and building durable peace mechanism.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Protestors under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Protestors under Fire
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of south Korea including the Pan-Islanders Measure Committee for Checking the Construction of Jeju Military Base, the Association of Kangjong Villagers and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held a press conference on Jeju Island on July 18 to protest the "government" authorities' crackdown on the actions against the military base construction.
					 Speakers at the conference accused the authorities of walking off and cracking down on activists including the chairman of the Inhabitants Measure Committee for Opposing the Construction of Jeju Naval Base for the mere reason that they offered resistance against the project.
					
					 The authorities should set free the unreasonably arrested people immediately and stop at once the project, they urged, warning:
					
					 If the authorities do not meet the demand, all the forces opposed to the construction of the naval base would declare a state of emergency and turn out in actions.
					
					 They demanded that the authorities withdraw all the repressive steps such as suing them for damage, a despicable use of money for crackdown.

articles.title: Outbursts of GNP's Representative Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Outbursts of GNP's Representative Flailed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on July 15 issued a commentary blasting the representative of the "Grand National Party" for his reckless remarks.
					 The commentary recalled that GNP's Representative Hong Jun Phyo heaped unspeakable vituperation on a woman reporter some days ago.
					
					 This guy threatened to gag the reporter just a few days after assuming the post of the representative, revealing his despicable colors, it charged.
					
					 The GNP had been ill-famed for being a party insulting women. Feeling not content with this, it earned the ill-fame of being a party free to utter wild words, the commentary added.
					
					 Hong was compelled to make an apology to a relevant media organization in face of the mounting public criticism,but it is not such a simple matter to be hushed up like this, the commentary said, stressing that there is no room for the arrogant GNP.

articles.title: S. Korean Police's Repressive Action against Participants in Candlelight Actions under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Police's Repressive Action against Participants in Candlelight Actions under Fire 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean police took such a repressive step as issuing summons to more than 200 students and citizens who participated in the candlelight actions for the settlement of registration fee issue to appear in the police station, the south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News said on July 16.
					 This action was taken on the strength of the evil laws including the "Law on Assembly and Demonstration". The police threatened to arrest them if they do not appear in the police station.
					
					 In this regard members of the Registration Fee Network and other organizations and students declared they would resolutely struggle against the base moves of the fascist police to weaken the candlelight actions.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Dictatorial Action Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Dictatorial Action Accused in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on July 16 carried an editorial accusing traitor Lee Myung Bak of his dictatorial and arbitrary action.
					 The reshuffle carried out by Lee Myung Bak against the people's mindset is nothing new but his informal designation of the minister of Justice and the chief prosecutor on July 15 was a more arbitrary action, the paper said, adding: Never has the proposal for informally designating Cabinet ministers evoked such strong uproar of public circles.
					
					 Nevertheless, Lee carried out the unreasonable reshuffle, it noted, predicting that with this reshuffle as an occasion, important posts of the "government" will be held by those hailing from the same areas and those who graduated from the same university as the chief executive did.
					
					 Kwon Jae Jin was informally designated to succeed to the minister of Justice though he was reported to have virtually steered the former chief prosecutor and the minister of Justice at the time when he was chief secretary for civil affairs and Han Sang Dae to succeed to the chief prosecutor though he downplayed, distorted and concealed irregularities and corruption of the ruling quarters, the editorial said, adding: It is, therefore, as clear as daylight how various laws will be enforced and lots of cases be investigated under the present regime.

articles.title: S. Korean Hit for Shunning Settlement of Registration Fee Issue
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Shunning Settlement of Registration Fee Issue
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean organizations including the Federation of University Students in the 21st Century and the Registration Fee Network held a candlelight rally in Seoul on July 15 denouncing the authorities for shunning the settlement of the registration fee issue.
					 Speakers at the rally charged that the Lee Myung Bak regime has not included even a petty amount of fund for the settlement of registration fee issue in the draft budget for next year despite the demand of the people.
					
					 Students and people from all walks of life will hold higher the candlelight, they declared.
					
					 They urged an extraordinary "National Assembly" session for the settlement of the registration fee issue.
					
					 Condemning the Lee regime for deteriorating the people's livelihood, the participants in the rally called for halving the registration fee without any condition.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Show to be Held in West Africa
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Show to be Held in West Africa
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the West African region for Kimilsungia show was inaugurated in Guinea on July 15 on the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the inaugural meeting.
					
					 The preparatory committee discussed an action plan for significantly organizing the Kimilsungia show of the West African region and an issue of briskly cultivating the flower of the sun according to the regional features.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported in Belarus
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported in Belarus
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The Social Federation "For the Union and Union's Communist Party" and the preparatory committee for founding the Communist Workers' Party in Belarus released a joint statement on July 12 to mark the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The statement recalled that the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces staged a war of aggression on the DPRK in the 1950s only to suffer a shameful defeat. 
					
					 It said:
					
					 The Korean people have never forgotten the Korean War.
					
					 The DPRK has enforced the Songun policy of giving priority to the military affairs to foil the constant threat and war moves on the part of the U.S. and its stooge, the south Korean puppet forces and had access to nuclear weapons to beat back the nuclear attack of the enemy.
					
					 The world community sincerely hopes that a peace agreement would be concluded between the DPRK and the U.S. at an early date, the U.S. forces pull out of south Korea and the line of independent peaceful reunification of Korea win an ultimate victory.
					
					 It should demand that the U.S. come out for dialogue, cease constant provocations and withdraw its forces from south Korea and thus provide the north and the south of Korea with conditions for settling the issue of reunification by themselves.
					
					 We extend full support to the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Foreign Papers
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of various countries carried special write-ups between July 2 and 10 to commemorate the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Democratic Congo's paper La Prosperite devoted its one whole page to an article titled "Kim Il Sung, founder of Socialist Korea" illustrated with his portrait.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 It was thanks to the President that the Korean people could have their genuine country and bring about epoch-making changes.
					
					 Finding himself among the people all his life, he devoted his all to their happiness.
					
					 He worked heart and soul for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and global independence.
					
					 He founded the great Juche idea, greatly contributing to the development of human thoughts and theories and performed feats to be specially recorded in the political history in the 20th century with his energetic leadership.
					
					 Another paper of this country L'Avenir carried an article with his photo, which stressed that he made great contributions to the socialist cause, the human cause of independence, holding high the banner of Juche.
					
					 Lao papers Congtap Pasason Lao and Vientiane Mai, Nepali papers Naya Kotparwa and Charcha, Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times, Indonesian paper Suara Karya and Ethiopian paper Daily Monitor carried articles with photos showing his revolutionary activities.
					
					 The articles introduced the revolutionary history and undying feats of the President, saying that the Korean army and people are faithfully putting his idea and intention into practice, always holding him in high esteem.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS Introduces DPRK's Opera "The Sea of Blood"
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS Introduces DPRK's Opera "The Sea of Blood" 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The ITAR-TASS of Russia on July 16 introduced "The Sea of Blood", a revolutionary opera of the DPRK.
					 It said:
					
					 The revolutionary opera "The Sea of Blood," a smash hit in the DPRK, is the longest in its history of performance.
					
					 The opera based on the bloody struggle of the people during Japan's occupation of Korea has been performed 1 600 times over the past four decades since its premiere.
					
					 Adapted from the work created by President Kim Il Sung, the founder of the DPRK, it is one of the five revolutionary operas.
					
					 It is being staged at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il brought about a radical turn in operas more than four decades ago in order to break outdated patterns that deterred operas from developing for a long period.
					
					 The opera "The Sea of Blood" was adapted from immortal masterpiece "The Sea of Blood" under his energetic leadership and raised its curtain in July 1971 for the first time.

articles.title: US Submarine Entry into S. Korea Aggravates Situation
articles.content:
U.S. Submarine Entry into S. Korea Aggravates Situation
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Recently, the U.S. nuclear submarine Texas entered Pusan Port of south Korea, aggravating the situation in northeast Asia, including the Korean peninsula, and drawing vigilance from countries concerned. 
					 The Chinese newspaper World News Journal on Tuesday said the U.S. military opened to the public the interior of Texas, which had been kept in strict secrecy, on July 11. The U.S. is going to start another trouble in the region, the newspaper noted.  
					
					 The U.S. is likely to take such actions as causing frictions between some countries and China in the south sea of China and, at the same time, invoke a conflict between the south and the north on the Korean peninsula, it said. The possible actions are aimed to curb the promotion of the Northeast Asia economic sphere and eventually drain China of its money.

articles.title: China Lodges Solemn Representations on Obama-Dalai Meeting
articles.content:
China Lodges Solemn Representations on Obama-Dalai Meeting
Beijing, July 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Chinese Foreign Ministry in a statement on July 17 lodged solemn representations on the U.S. chief executive's meeting with the Dalai Lama despite the opposition.
					 The U.S. side not only allowed the Dalai Lama to visit the U.S. but made obstinate arrangement of its chief executive's meeting with the Dalai Lama and thus gravely breached the basic rules of international relations and damaged the Sino-American relations, the spokesperson said, and went on:
					
					 The Dalai Lama is a political exile who has served the separatist activities against China under the guise of religion for a long period.  China is resolutely opposed to any chief executive's meeting with the Dalai Lama in any form.
					
					 The U.S. should stop interfering in the internal affairs of China and neither connive nor support the separatist forces standing for "Tibet independence".
					
					 That day the vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China made an urgent summon to the charge d'affaires of the U.S. embassy in Beijing to lodge solemn representations on the U.S. arrangement of its chief executive's meeting with the Dalai Lama

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Training Able Servicepersons
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Training Able Servicepersons 
Beijing, July 19 (KCNA) -- Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, called for training able servicepersons of a new type on July 13. 
					 Addressing the 16th meeting of military academies Guo, who is also a member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, said that President Hu Jintao has attached top priority to military schools and advanced a series of important theories on their position, role and mission. 
					
					 He underlined the need to carry on the training of able servicepersons in such a way as putting the Chinese army on IT basis and meeting the requirement of future operations.

articles.title: New Juvenile Songs Created in China
articles.content:
New Juvenile Songs Created in China 
Beijing, July 19 (KCNA) -- New juvenile songs have been created in China to mark the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China. 
					 A presentation of juvenile songs took place at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on July 15 under the sponsorship of the C.C., the Communist Youth League and the children's organization.

articles.title: Chinese Party Official Called on Young Cadres to Work Hard
articles.content:
Chinese Party Official Urges Young Cadres to Work Hard 
Beijing, July 19 (KCNA) -- A top official of the Communist Party of China (CPC) called on young cadres to devote themselves to the cause of the party and the people.
					 Li Yuanchao, head of the Organization Department of the CPC Central Committee, made the call at a round-table talk with young people studying at the Party School.
					
					 Li, who is also a member of the Political Bureau and a member of the Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee, said middle-aged and young cadres are strategic successors to the cause of the party and cause.
					
					 They should regard the people as teacher and serve for them, deeply aware of their historic mission, he added.

articles.title: Senior Chinese Official Calls for Training More High-Caliber Special Police
articles.content:
Senior Chinese Official Calls for Training More High-Caliber Special Police
Beijing, July 19 (KCNA) -- A senior Chinese official called for strengthening the effort to train more high-caliber special police on July 13.
					 Zhou Yongkang, secretary of the Central Commission of Politics, inspected the special police college of the People's Armed Police in Beijing that day.
					
					 During the inspection tour, he, who is also a member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, underscored the need to facilitate the building of a modernized armed force to make it possible for the police to defend the security of the country and social stability and properly serve for the people.

articles.title: Senior Official of China Calls for Implementing Speech of Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Senior Official of China Calls for Implementing Speech of Hu Jintao
Beijing, July 19 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, called for studying and embodying the spirit of the speech made by President Hu Jintao on July 1. 
					 Having a talk with political department chiefs of Beijing-based units on July 14, he said that doing so is an important political task and a long-term tactical duty.
					
					 Xu, who is also a member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, stressed units at all levels should enhance ideological consciousness, strengthen organizational work and leadership and take effective measures to open a new phase of scientific development in the defense and army building.

articles.title: China Will Fulfill Mission as SCO Chair Country: Official
articles.content:
China Will Fulfill Mission as SCO Chair Country: Official 
Beijing, July 19 (KCNA) -- China gives top priority to fulfilling its mission as chair country of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) and is consulting with member nations about its working plan and action program for one year. 
					 Cheng Guoping, assistant to the foreign minister of China, made the remark at a press conference in Beijing on July 14.  
					
					 China seeks to boost practical cooperation among the member nations, strengthen solidarity and mutual confidence, defend the regional security, promote economic cooperation and expand cultural exchange, he said. In this way, China will help SCO enter the second decade of its development.

articles.title: Sudan to Launch New Currency
articles.content:
Sudan to Launch New Currency
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The governor of the Central Bank of Sudan on July 16 announced that the country would launch a new currency this month. 
					The replacement of the old currency will take two or three months, said a news report.

articles.title: Cuba Plans to Increase Sugar Production
articles.content:
Cuba Plans to Increase Sugar Production
Havana, July 19 (KCNA) -- Cuba plans to bring its annual sugar production to 2.5 million tons by 2015.
					 The Cuban authorities have launched a project to modernize the machinery used at the country's sugar mills.

articles.title: Cuba Celebrates Children's Day
articles.content:
Cuba Celebrates Children's Day
Havana, July 19 (KCNA) -- Cuba celebrated the Children's Day on July 17. 
					 Cuban children enjoyed special radio and TV programs that day. 
					
					 Picture book exhibitions, concerts, dramas and other events were held in avenues, plazas, parks and cultural, sports and recreational facilities.

articles.title: Iran Condemns US Conspiratorial Moves
articles.content:
Iran Condemns US Conspiratorial Moves
Tehran, July 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is the chief culprit of all terrorist acts in Iraq, said the vice-chairman of the National Security and Foreign Policy Committee of the Iranian Majlis when interviewed by a news agency on July 16.
					 The U.S. is manipulating terrorist acts in Iraq and seeks to foster religious disputes, he noted.
					
					 He called upon all the Muslims to shatter the U.S. conspiratorial moves by their concerted efforts.
					
					 The secretary-general of Iran's High Council of Human Rights on July 15 protested against the West's moves against his country.
					
					 The enemies scheme to paralyze the sound consciousness of Iran's youth and children through bourgeois ideological and cultural poisoning and propaganda campaign, he said.
					
					 All the Iranian people will heighten vigilance to decisively shatter the sordid moves of the enemies, he added.

articles.title: Iran Beefs up Its Naval Force
articles.content:
Iran Beefs up Its Naval Force
Tehran, July 19 (KCNA) -- Iran is directing sustained great efforts to beefing up its naval force.
					 Minister of Defense Brigadier General Ahmad Vahidi disclosed that new models of vessels and submarines for the navy are on the way. He said this when interviewed by IRNA on July 15.

articles.title: Eurozone Trade Deficit
articles.content:
Eurozone Trade Deficit
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- For the EU, its trade deficit amounted to 13.2 billion euros (18.6 billion dollars) in May, according to the EU statistics bureau on Friday.

articles.title: ASEAN Countries Cooperate in Disaster Relief
articles.content:
ASEAN Countries Cooperate in Disaster Relief 
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- ASEAN countries are striving to strengthen cooperation in disaster relief.
					 The first ASEAN humanitarian and disaster relief exercise in West Java of Indonesia ended on Thursday.
					
					 The three-day exercise was participated in by more than 100 military personnel and medical experts from Singapore, Indonesia and other ASEAN countries.
					
					 The drill strengthened the ties among ASEAN militaries and enhanced ASEAN's capacity for disaster relief operations.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- China and India on July 14 pledged to promote bilateral relations to a new higher stage.
					 Iranian and Ukrainian officials on July 13 agreed to increase the volume of trade exchange between the two countries.

articles.title: Fiji to Direct Efforts to Rural Development: Fiji PM
articles.content:
Fiji to Direct Efforts to Rural Development: Fiji PM
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Fiji's Prime Minister Commodore Voreqe Bainimarama said the government has directed efforts to electrifying the countryside in the past to ensure that more families will enjoy improved living standards. He underlined the need to push forward this work in the future, too, to expand the rural electrification coverage.
					 The government will make positive development of the infrastructure such as roads and water reticulation systems in the rural areas, he noted.

articles.title: Large Amount of Drugs Seized in Turkey
articles.content:
Large Amount of Drugs Seized in Turkey
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The Turkish police confiscated 50 kg of heroin in a joint operation of narcotic teams from eastern province of Van and southern province of Kilis on Friday.
					 In another operation, Turkish security forces confiscated 133 kg of hashish hidden at a flour mill in Fethiye town of the western province of Mugla on Friday.

articles.title: Communications Satellite Launched in India
articles.content:
Communications Satellite Launched in India
New Delhi, July 19 (KCNA) -- India launched new communications satellite GSAT-12 on July 15.
					 The 1,410 kg satellite was successfully launched by a carrier rocket PSLV-C17 at a space center in the southern area.
					
					 It will be used for medical science, a report said.

articles.title: Volcano Erupts in Indonesia, Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Volcano Erupts in Indonesia, Earthquake Hits Japan
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Volcano erupted again in North Sulawesi Province, Indonesia on July 17, throwing volcanic ash 3,000-3,500 meters high into the air. 
					 A 5.2-magnitude earthquake hit Ogasawara Islands, Japan on July 16.
					
					 The epicenter was waters around the islands.

articles.title: Forest Fire Expands in Far Eastern Region of Russia
articles.content:
Forest Fire Expands in Far Eastern Region of Russia
Moscow, July 19 (KCNA) -- Damage caused by forest fire is expanding in the Far Eastern Region of Russia sweeping more than 5,540 hectares.
					 Forest fire burned about 2,000 hectares in the region on July 17 alone.
					
					 An emergency step is being taken to extinguish the fire.

articles.title: Corea enmienda y adiciona ley de marca commercial
articles.content:
Corea enmienda y adiciona ley de marca comercial
Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- Recientemente, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea enmendo y adiciono cierto contenido de la ley de marca comercial de los capitulos I y V.
					　En el capitulo I: Principio de la Ley de Marca Comercial fueron enmendados los articulos 2, 5 y 6, que determinan la marca y sus especies, los principios de proteccion, modernizacion y cientifizacion del derecho de marca.
					
					　En el capitulo V: Direccion y Control del Trabajo de Marca, los articulos 41, 42, 43, 44 y 47, que dilucidan la publicacion de los organos administrativos y de los puntos referentes, el fortalecimiento de la base material y tecnica y formacion de funcionarios en la rama de trabajo, la prohibicion de acciones ilegales referentes a la marca, la indemnizacion, la confiscacion, la prohibicion de gestion, etc.
					
					　La ley de marca comercial enmendada tiene suma importancia por asegurar la garantia legal que permite elevar la calidad de las mercancias y proteger el derecho de marca conforme a desarrollo de la economia  y a la creciente produccion de mercancias.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegacion vietnamita
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegacion vietnamita
Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dirigiera la delegacion del departamento de prensa e informacion del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de Vietnam presidida por el director general Nguyen Phuong Nga, de visita en Corea.
					　El jefe de la delegacion lo entrego el dia 20 a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun se refiere a la zona economica y comercial de Rason
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun se refiere a la zona economica y comercial de Rason
Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- La zona economica y comercial de Rason de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea tiene la condicion favorable como centro de comercios e inversiones mundiales que entrelaza las zonas del Nordeste Asiatico, la Europa y la America del Norte porque esta colindada con China y Rusia con el rio Tuman en el centro.
					　Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					　La zona del Nordeste Asiatico abarca Corea, 3 provincias del Nordeste de China (Heilongjiang, Jilin y Liaoning), el Lejano Oriente de Rusia, Mongolia, Japon, etc., cuya poblacion es cientos de millones y la superficie llega a 9 millones 168 mil kilometros cuadrados. Los paises de esta zona tienen las condiciones favorables para cooperarse e intercambiarse economicamente. 
					
					　En la zona del Nordeste de China se extiende a la zona montanosa incluyendo los montes altos ligados con el monte Paektu de Corea y la tierra fertil.
					
					　La cantidad de produccion anual de cereales alcanza a decenas de millones de toneladas, de entre la cantidad de produccion de soya ocupa primer lugar  en el mundo. En esta region hay el bosque maderero de gran valor economico, las plantas medicinales de cientos de generos y los recursos naturales incluyendo recursos de mineral metalico de mas de cien generos.
					
					　La zona del Lejano Oriente de Rusia colindada con la ciudad de Rason tiene la frontera con la zona del nordeste de Mongolia y con China a intervalos del rio Amur (Heilongjiang) y el Ussuri.
					
					　En esta zona montanosa son abundantes los recursos de bosque, petroleo, gas natural, estano, plomo, zinc, etc.
					
					　La zona economica y comercial de Rason esta situada en la posicion geografica mas favorable a  unir 3 provincias del Nordeste de China, el Lejano Oriente de Rusia y Mongolia, zonas prometedoras de desarrollo economico y comercial. Se dice que el mar del puerto del Lejano Oriente de Rusia se congela en invierno.
					
					　En este sentido, la zona de Rason es el lugar mas propicio.
					
					　La zona economica y comercial de Rason sera en el futuro la de amistad que contribuya en comun a la economia, el transporte y el fomento de bienestar de los pueblos de Corea y China y a la larga, promovera el desarrollo economico de la region del Nordeste Asiatico y ayudara al desarrollo mundial.
					
					　La ventaja de la zona de Rason como la de economia y comercio se probo a traves de la ceremonia inaugural de reconstruccion del ferrocarril Rajin-Khasan y el puerto de Rajin efectuada entre la RPDC y Rusia en 2008.
					
					　Si se abre esta ruta nueva, puede ser reducida la distancia de transporte de Asia a Europa y se ahorraria el gasto de transporte en gran cantidad.

articles.title: Lluvias torrenciales atacan rama carbonifera de Corea
articles.content:
Lluvias torrenciales atacan rama carbonifera de Corea
Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- Las minas carboniferas en distintas localidades de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea quedaron danadas por las lluvias fuertes que cayeron del dia 12 al 15.
					　Fueron sumergidos mas de 30 minas de carbon, decenas de pozos y mas de 150 galerias de explotacion de carbon de la zona occidental.
					
					　Ademas, se perdieron cientos de miles de toneladas de carbon en mas de 40 depositos de carbon.
					
					　En las zonas de Sunchon, Tokchon y Pukchang muchos puentes quedaron cortados y destruidas acroteras ferroviarias por el derrumbe de montes, lo cual causo la paralisis del transporte obstaculizando el transporte de carbon.
					
					　Tambien quedaron anegados numerosos pozos y galerias de explotacion de carbon de las minas carboniferas de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur  y la zona de Chonnae y no funcionan bien los equipos de bombeo a causa de la interrupcion electrica.
					
					　Por lo tanto, el sector de la industria electrica se enfrenta a las dificultades por la insuficiente produccion de carbon y por la paralisis de transporte en dichas zonas.
